column4: guys, I am starting to be a bit fed up. I have installed kernel-tree package and am looking form the sources of a single module (forcedeth) - and nothing!
apt-cache search forcedeth gives nothing, too
it's under device drivers->network->pci->nforce
locate nforce | grep network gives nothing
did you try locate forcedeth.c
well.. you should have it
locate forcedeth only gives me some *.h and *.ko files
I *JUST* showed you where it is
notice that you are using a gentoo kernel :)
whatever, it'll be in there
guess what - no such file or directory (tried: cd /usr/src/linux/drivers/net/)
looks like we found your problem. you don't have the kernel sources installed
I have installed kernel-tree package (which depends on kernel-tree and kernel-debian-patches) *before* I have asked the question.
updatedb; locate forcedeth.c does not show *anything*
ll -R / | grep forcedeth.c the same
well, I just looked on my laptop and the file I say exists, does in fact exist
now I give up. I *have* the newest sources installed and haven't got that file. are you using Breezy (5.10)? Or Dapper? (I'm a Breezyrian).
well, I'm doing a dist-upgrade right now. but the sources are from breezy
ok, I'll try to install kernel-tree-2.6.10 instead of *-2.6.11
why not upgrade?
$uname -r: 2.6.12-10-k7 - now when you tell me where the *hell* are the sources for the bastard, I'll be more than happy
man, I've already held your hand long enough and you keep telling me I'm wrong when I'm not
yep, you're right, sorry. I installed kernel-tree-* instead of linux-tree-*
yep, installing it right now...
